serverProxy

Class RealProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverProxy.RealProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerProxy

    public class RealProxy
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerProxy
    The 'real' proxy will communicate with the server over http protocol to interact with the server api.
    Version:
    1.0 Build Winter 2016.
    Author:
    Christian Riboldi, Clayton Condie, Jacob Brewer, Joshua Powers, Joshua Van Steeter

    • Constructor Summary

      • joinGame

        public boolean joinGame(int gameId,
                        CatanColor color)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Adds (or re-adds) the player to the specified game, and sets their catan.game HTTP cookie
        Specified by:
        joinGame in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to join.
        color - ['red' or 'green' or 'blue' or 'yellow' or 'puce' or 'brown' or 'white' or 'purple' or 'orange']: What color you want to join (or rejoin) as.
        Returns:
        True if joining the game was successful, false if an error occurred.

      • saveGame

        public boolean saveGame(int gameId,
                        java.lang.String fileName)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Saves the current state of the specified game to a file. This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Specified by:
        saveGame in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to save.
        fileName - The file name you want to save it under.
        Returns:
        True if save is successful, false if an error occurred.

      • loadGame

        public boolean loadGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Loads a previously saved game file to restore the state of a game. This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Specified by:
        loadGame in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the saved game file that you want to load. (The game's ID is restored as well.)
        Returns:
        True if load is successful, false if an error occurred.

      • getGameModel

        public GameModelJSON getGameModel(int modelNumber)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Returns the current state of the game in JSON format. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        getGameModel in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        modelNumber - The version number of the model that the caller already has. It goes up by one for each command that is applied. If you send this parameter, you will get a model back only if the current model is newer than the specified version number. Otherwise, it returns the string "true" to notify the caller that it already has the current model state.
        Returns:
        The current state of the game in a game model JSON object

      • resetGame

        public GameModelJSON resetGame()
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Clears out the command history of the current game For the default games created by the server, this method reverts the game to the state immediately after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method reverts the game to the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round). This method returns the client model JSON for the game after it has been reset. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        resetGame in interface ServerProxy
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • setCommands

        public GameModelJSON setCommands(java.util.List<Command> commands)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Executes the specified command list in the current game. This method can be used for testing and debugging. Typically, the command list passed in was previously obtained by calling the /game/command (GET) method. This method returns the client model JSON for the game after the command list has been applied. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        setCommands in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        commands - The list of commands to be executed
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • getCommands

        public java.util.List<Command> getCommands()
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Returns a list of commands that have been executed in the current game. This method can be used for testing and debugging. The command list returned by this method can be passed to the /game/command (POST) method. For the default games created by the server, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed in the game since the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round). You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        getCommands in interface ServerProxy
        Returns:
        Returns the list of Commands that have occurred since the game was initialized

      • addAI

        public boolean addAI(java.lang.String AIType)
        Description copied from interface: ServerProxy
        Adds an AI player to the current game. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        addAI in interface ServerProxy
        Parameters:
        AIType - The type of AI player to add (currently, LARGEST_ARMY is the only supported type). Only strings returned by /game/listAI are valid.
        Returns:
        True if method was successful, false if an error occured.

      • listAI
